channel.title: SOLID on DeviCode

item.title: #002 | The 5 SOLID principles
item.description: S.O.L.I.D.The 5 principles of SOLID are: S - Single Responsibility - Single Responsibility O - Open/Closed Principle - Open/Closed Principle L - Liskov Substitution Principle - Liskov Substitution Principle I - Interface Segregation - Segregation of interfaces D - Depencency Injection - Dependency Injection 1 | Single ResponsabilityThe principle of single responsibility determines that each member of the system has only one responsibility. Methods must have a single and clear function - it is a bad sign if you have to use the conjunction And in the method’s name.
